title: Permit-to-Work and Shift Handovers
content: PTW systems control hazardous work. Major accidents have occurred when permits weren't communicated across shifts or between contractors and operators. Shift handovers transfer situational awareness—face-to-face handovers are better than logs alone. Use structured formats like SBAR. Verify the incoming shift understands active permits and system status.

mcq.question: During shift handover, the outgoing supervisor mentions 'a few permits active, nothing major.' What's the problem?

options.A: No problem—permits are logged in the system
options.B: Too vague—incoming supervisor needs specific permit details and hazards
options.D: Incoming supervisor should check the log independently

mcq.explanation: Vague handovers fail to transfer critical situational awareness. Specific permit details, hazards, and work status must be communicated face-to-face.
